meta.title: Page Structure Checker | Free SEO Analysis Tool to Visualize Web Page Structure & Heading Hierarchy
meta.description: Check HTML structure and heading tags (h1-h6) hierarchy to confirm SEO-friendly content structure. The first step to structured content creation.
meta.keywords: page structure, heading structure, seo checker, h1 tag, title tag, meta description

title: Page Structure Checker
description: Check if your webpage has a proper structure with appropriate title, description, and heading tags hierarchy

error.title: Error
error.urlRequired: Please enter a URL to analyze
error.invalidUrl: Please enter a valid URL (including http:// or https://)
error.networkError: Network error - please check your connection
error.timeoutError: The request timed out - the server might be busy
error.parsingError: Failed to parse the page structure
error.invalidJson: Invalid request: Could not parse JSON body
error.emptyHtml: Empty HTML response from the target URL
error.timeout: Request timed out. The page might be too large or unavailable

headingsExplanation: Properly structured headings help search engines understand your content organization and improve user experience
contentStructureExplanation: A well-structured content hierarchy is essential for both SEO and accessibility
noHeadings: No heading tags found in the page
noH1: The page does not have an h1 tag
multipleH1: The page has multiple h1 tags (should only have one)

overview.title: Overview
overview.content:
Page Structure Checker is a free online tool that visually examines heading hierarchy and HTML structure of web pages.
For search engines to properly understand your pages, logical structure (h1-h6) and section organization are essential. With this tool, simply enter a URL to visualize the entire page's heading structure in a tree format, gaining insights to create SEO-friendly content architecture.

steps.title: Enter the URL of the webpage you want to check
steps.description: Input the URL of the page you want to analyze in the form.

steps.title: Click the "Analyze Structure" button
steps.description: The tool will analyze the heading tags and structure information from the page's HTML.

steps.title: Review the heading structure in tree view
steps.description: Visually examine the h1-h6 heading structure, order, and any missing or duplicate issues in a tree format.

users.name: User A (SEO Specialist)
users.comment: "I use this when creating page structures. It immediately shows if h2 and h3 hierarchies are intact, which helps with draft checking."

users.name: User B (Web Director)
users.comment: "I visually organize existing page structures to make improvement proposals. It helps not just with layout modifications but also SEO optimization."

users.name: User C (Writer & Blogger)
users.comment: "I was worried if my articles had a logical structure. When I checked the heading sequence with this tool, I discovered I had multiple h1 tags."

items.title: Visualize h1-h6 tag structure in tree format
items.description: Display webpage heading structures in an easy-to-understand tree format. Quickly identify structural mistakes like duplicate headings or skipped hierarchy levels.

items.title: Support logical structure design
items.description: Proper heading hierarchy is crucial for both SEO and accessibility in page structures read by search engines and screen readers. Take the first step in checking and improving your content organization.

items.title: Perfect for draft pages and pre-rewrite diagnostics
items.description: Check structure in both existing pages and article drafts to prevent production mistakes and SEO oversights. Also useful for quality checks before delivery.

items.title: Free, no registration, accessible to everyone
items.description: Analysis is complete with just a URL input. A structure checking tool that's easy to use even for web beginners and writers.

questions.question: Q1. Can I check structures other than heading tags (h1-h6)?
questions.answer: A. Currently, the tool focuses on visualizing heading tag structures. We plan to support section tags and other elements in the future.

questions.question: Q2. What happens if there are multiple h1 tags?
questions.answer: A. All h1 tags will be detected and listed. If multiple exist, an error or warning will be displayed.

questions.question: Q3. Is there a feature to automatically fix structural issues?
questions.answer: A. No, this tool specializes in visualizing structure and identifying problems. Modifications must be made manually.

questions.question: Q4. Can I use it with local HTML files?
questions.answer: A. Currently, only webpage checking through URL specification is supported. Local file support is under consideration for future updates.

questions.question: Q5. Is the URL data I enter saved?
questions.answer: A. No, analysis data and URLs are automatically deleted after a certain period and are not saved. We are mindful of your privacy.
